metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for installing and maintaining network security controls are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection; PL-1 security planning policy; CM-1 configuration management policy.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI requires specific network security control documentation. SP 800-53 covers through policy and boundary controls.

clauses.title: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection with configuration; CM-6 configuration settings; CM-2 baselines; AC-4 information flow.

clauses.title: Configuration standards for NSC rulesets are defined, implemented, maintained
clauses.rationale: SC-7 configuration; CM-2 baseline configuration; CM-6 configuration settings.

clauses.title: All services, protocols, and ports allowed are identified, approved, and have a defined business need
clauses.rationale: CM-7 least functionality (deny by default); SC-7(5) deny by default/allow by exception.

clauses.title: Configuration files for NSCs are secured from unauthorized access and kept consistent with active network configurations
clauses.rationale: CM-6 configuration file management; AC-3 access enforcement; CM-3 change control.

clauses.title: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection; AC-4 information flow enforcement; SC-7(5) deny by default.

clauses.title: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled
clauses.rationale: SC-7 with boundary control enhancements for DMZ, filtering, and restricted connections.

clauses.title: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary; AC-19 mobile device access; AC-20 external system use.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI specifically addresses dual-homed devices. SP 800-53 covers through general boundary and device controls.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for applying secure configurations to all system components are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: CM-1 configuration management policy; CM-2 baseline; CM-6 settings.

clauses.title: System components are configured and managed securely
clauses.rationale: CM-2 baseline configuration; CM-6 configuration settings; CM-7 least functionality.

clauses.title: Vendor default accounts are managed: changed, removed, or disabled
clauses.rationale: CM-6 configuration settings (change defaults); AC-2 account management; IA-5 authenticator management.

clauses.title: Vendor default accounts are managed if used
clauses.rationale: AC-2 account management; IA-5 authenticator management; CM-6 settings.

clauses.title: All unnecessary functionality is removed or disabled
clauses.rationale: CM-7 directly covers least functionality (remove unnecessary services, ports, protocols).

clauses.title: All non-console administrative access is encrypted using strong cryptography
clauses.rationale: AC-17 remote access with encryption; SC-8 transmission protection; SC-13 cryptographic protection.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for protecting stored account data are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: SC-28 protection at rest; MP-1 media policy; PL-1 security planning.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI requires specific account data protection documentation. SP 800-53 covers through general data protection controls.

clauses.title: Storage of account data is kept to a minimum
clauses.rationale: SI-12 information lifecycle; PM-25 minimization of PII.
clauses.gaps: PCI requires specific data retention policies and purging for account data. SP 800-53 covers data minimization but PCI-specific account data requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Sensitive authentication data (SAD) is not stored after authorization
clauses.rationale: SI-12 information lifecycle; SC-28 protection of information at rest.
clauses.gaps: PCI has very specific requirements about SAD non-storage (CVV, PIN, track data). SP 800-53 doesn't address payment-specific data types.

clauses.title: Access to displays of full PAN and ability to copy cardholder data are restricted
clauses.rationale: AC-3 access enforcement; AC-6 least privilege; SI-19 de-identification.
clauses.gaps: PCI specifically requires PAN masking/truncation displays. SP 800-53 covers access restriction but PAN-specific display controls are payment-industry specific.

clauses.title: Primary account number (PAN) is secured wherever it is stored
clauses.rationale: SC-28 protection at rest with encryption; SC-12 key management; SC-13 cryptographic protection.
clauses.gaps: PCI has specific PAN encryption requirements (disk vs. field-level). SP 800-53 covers encryption at rest generally but PAN-specific requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Cryptographic keys used to protect stored account data are secured
clauses.rationale: SC-12 cryptographic key establishment and management with key management processes.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI has very specific key management procedures. SC-12 covers key management comprehensively.

clauses.title: Where cryptography is used to protect stored account data, key management processes and procedures covering all aspects of the key lifecycle are defined and implemented
clauses.rationale: SC-12 covers key lifecycle management.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI specifies key custodian acknowledgment and split knowledge/dual control.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for protecting cardholder data with strong cryptography during transmission over open, public networks are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: SC-8 transmission protection; SC-13 cryptographic protection; PL-1 security planning.

clauses.title: PAN is protected with strong cryptography during transmission
clauses.rationale: SC-8 transmission confidentiality/integrity; SC-8(1) cryptographic protection; SC-13 cryptographic protection.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 transmission encryption controls are comprehensive.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for protecting all systems and networks from malicious software are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: SI-3 malicious code protection; SI-1 system and information integrity policy.

clauses.title: Malicious software (malware) is prevented, or detected and addressed
clauses.rationale: SI-3 with comprehensive enhancements for centralized management, automatic updates.

clauses.title: Anti-malware mechanisms and processes are active, maintained, and monitored
clauses.rationale: SI-3 with ongoing maintenance and monitoring enhancements.

clauses.title: Anti-phishing mechanisms protect users against phishing attacks
clauses.rationale: SI-8 spam protection; AT-2(2) social engineering awareness; SC-7 boundary protection.
clauses.gaps: PCI v4.0.1 added anti-phishing. SP 800-53 covers through spam, training, and boundary controls but dedicated anti-phishing control is less explicit.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for developing and maintaining secure systems and software are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: SA-3 system development lifecycle; SA-1 system and services acquisition policy; SA-15 development standards.

clauses.title: Bespoke and custom software are developed securely
clauses.rationale: SA family comprehensive for secure development.

clauses.title: Bespoke and custom software are developed securely: training
clauses.rationale: AT-3 role-based training; SA-16 developer-provided training.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI requires annual secure coding training.

clauses.title: Bespoke and custom software is reviewed prior to being released into production to identify and correct potential coding vulnerabilities
clauses.rationale: SA-11 developer security testing with static and dynamic analysis enhancements.

clauses.title: Security vulnerabilities are identified and addressed
clauses.rationale: RA-5 vulnerability scanning; SI-2 flaw remediation; SI-5 security alerts.

clauses.title: All system components are protected from known vulnerabilities by installing applicable security patches/updates
clauses.rationale: SI-2 flaw remediation with automated patching.

clauses.title: Public-facing web applications are protected against attacks
clauses.rationale: SC-7 boundary protection; SI-3 malware; SA-11 testing; SC-7(17) automated enforcement.
clauses.gaps: PCI requires WAF or equivalent for public web apps. SP 800-53 doesn't specifically mandate WAF but addresses through general application and boundary controls.

clauses.title: Changes to all system components are managed securely
clauses.rationale: CM-3 change control; CM-4 impact analysis; CM-5 access restrictions; SA-10 developer configuration management.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for restricting access to system components and cardholder data by business need to know are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: AC-1 access control policy; AC-6 least privilege; PL-1 security planning.

clauses.title: Access to system components and data is appropriately defined and assigned
clauses.rationale: AC-2 account management; AC-3 access enforcement; AC-6 least privilege; AC-5 separation of duties.

clauses.title: Access to system components and data is managed via an access control system(s)
clauses.rationale: AC-3 access enforcement; AC-25 reference monitor.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for identifying users and authenticating access to system components are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: IA-1 identification/authentication policy; IA-2 user identification; PL-1 planning.

clauses.title: User identification and related accounts for users and administrators are strictly managed throughout an account's lifecycle
clauses.rationale: AC-2 account lifecycle management; IA-4 identifier management; IA-5 authenticator management.

clauses.title: Strong authentication for users and administrators is established and managed
clauses.rationale: IA-2 authentication; IA-5 authenticator management with password enhancements; IA-2(1) MFA.

clauses.title: If passwords/passphrases are used as authentication factors, minimum level of complexity requirements
clauses.rationale: IA-5(1) directly covers password complexity requirements.

clauses.title: If passwords/passphrases are used as the only authentication factor for user access, passwords/passphrases are changed at least every 90 days
clauses.rationale: IA-5(1) covers password lifecycle. Note: NIST 800-63B now recommends against periodic password rotation, creating a philosophical difference.
clauses.gaps: Gap in alignment: PCI still requires periodic rotation while NIST guidance has moved toward event-based password changes. This represents a deliberate policy divergence.

clauses.title: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE
clauses.rationale: IA-2(1)/(2) multi-factor authentication for privileged and non-privileged accounts.

clauses.title: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) systems are configured to prevent misuse
clauses.rationale: IA-2 MFA enhancements cover MFA configuration. IA-2(6) network access; IA-2(8) replay resistance.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI has specific MFA anti-replay and independence requirements. SP 800-53 covers through MFA enhancements.

clauses.title: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed
clauses.rationale: AC-2 account management; IA-5 authenticator management; AC-6(5) privileged accounts.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI specifically addresses service/application account management. SP 800-53 covers through general account management.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for restricting physical access to cardholder data are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: PE-1 physical and environmental protection policy; PL-1 security planning.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI-specific scope for cardholder data.

clauses.title: Physical access controls manage entry into facilities and systems containing cardholder data
clauses.rationale: PE-2 access authorizations; PE-3 access control; PE-6 monitoring; PE-7 visitor control; PE-8 access records.

clauses.title: Physical access for personnel and visitors is authorized and managed
clauses.rationale: PE-2/PE-3 personnel access; PE-7/PE-8 visitor management.

clauses.title: Media with cardholder data is securely stored, accessed, distributed, and destroyed
clauses.rationale: MP family comprehensively covers media lifecycle.

clauses.title: Point of interaction (POI) devices are protected from tampering and unauthorized substitution
clauses.rationale: PE-3 physical access; SR-9 tamper resistance; SR-10 inspection; SR-11 component authenticity.
clauses.gaps: PCI has very specific POI device inspection and tamper-evidence requirements. SP 800-53 covers physical security and supply chain integrity but POI-specific requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for logging and monitoring all access to system components and cardholder data are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: AU-1 audit and accountability policy; PL-1 security planning.

clauses.title: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events
clauses.rationale: AU-2 auditable events; AU-3 content; AU-12 audit generation.

clauses.title: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications
clauses.rationale: AU-9 protection of audit information with access enforcement.

clauses.title: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity
clauses.rationale: AU-6 audit review/analysis; AU-6(1) automated process integration; SI-4 monitoring.

clauses.title: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis
clauses.rationale: AU-11 directly covers audit record retention.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. PCI requires 12 months with 3 months immediately available.

clauses.title: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems
clauses.rationale: AU-8 timestamps; AU-8(1) synchronization with authoritative time source.

clauses.title: Failures of critical security control systems are detected, reported, and responded to promptly
clauses.rationale: AU-5 response to processing failures; SI-4(5) system alerts; IR-4 incident handling; IR-6 reporting.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI specifically addresses security control failure detection (IDS, FIM, log, access control). SP 800-53 covers through general monitoring.

clauses.title: Processes and mechanisms for regularly testing security of systems and networks are defined and understood
clauses.rationale: CA-1 assessment policy; PL-1 security planning.

clauses.title: Wireless access points are identified and monitored, and unauthorized wireless access points are addressed
clauses.rationale: SI-4 monitoring; CM-8 inventory; AC-18 wireless access.
clauses.gaps: PCI specifically requires wireless scanning. SP 800-53 AC-18 covers wireless but specific rogue AP scanning less explicit.

clauses.title: External and internal vulnerabilities are regularly identified, prioritized, and addressed
clauses.rationale: RA-5 vulnerability scanning; SI-2 flaw remediation.

clauses.title: External and internal penetration testing is regularly performed, and exploitable vulnerabilities and security weaknesses are corrected
clauses.rationale: CA-8 penetration testing; CA-8(1) independent penetration agent.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI specifies annual external and internal penetration testing with specific scope (CDE). CA-8 covers testing generally.

clauses.title: Network intrusions and unexpected file changes are detected and responded to
clauses.rationale: SI-7 software/firmware integrity; SI-4 intrusion detection; IR-4 incident response; AU-6 audit review.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. PCI FIM and IDS/IPS requirements well covered.

clauses.title: Unauthorized changes on payment pages are detected and responded to
clauses.rationale: SI-7 integrity monitoring; SI-4 monitoring; CM-3 change control.
clauses.gaps: PCI v4.0.1 added payment page script monitoring. SP 800-53 covers general integrity monitoring but web page/script change detection is more specific.

clauses.title: A comprehensive information security policy that governs and provides direction for protection of the entity's information assets is known and current
clauses.rationale: SP 800-53 has comprehensive policy controls across all families.

clauses.title: Acceptable use policies for end-user technologies are defined and implemented
clauses.rationale: PL-4 rules of behavior; AC-20 use of external systems.

clauses.title: Risks to the cardholder data environment are formally identified, evaluated, and managed
clauses.rationale: RA-3 risk assessment; PM-9 risk strategy; RA-2 security categorization.

clauses.title: PCI DSS compliance is managed (for service providers)
clauses.rationale: CA-2 assessments; CA-7 continuous monitoring; PM-6 performance measurement.
clauses.gaps: PCI-specific compliance management requirements (quarterly confirmation, annual scope review). SP 800-53 covers assessment but PCI compliance management is more specific.

clauses.title: PCI DSS scope is documented and validated
clauses.rationale: PL-2 security plan; CM-8 inventory; CA-2 assessment.
clauses.gaps: PCI requires specific CDE scope documentation and validation. SP 800-53 system boundary concepts are similar but PCI scope validation methodology differs.

clauses.title: Security awareness education is an ongoing activity
clauses.rationale: AT family comprehensive for security awareness and training.

clauses.title: Personnel are screened to reduce risks from insider threats
clauses.rationale: PS-3 personnel screening; PS-7 third-party personnel.

clauses.title: Risk to information assets associated with third party service provider (TPSP) relationships is managed
clauses.rationale: SA-4 acquisition; SA-9 external services; SR family supply chain.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI has specific TPSP management requirements. SP 800-53 covers through general vendor/supply chain controls.

clauses.title: Third-party service providers (TPSPs) support their customers' PCI DSS compliance (for TPSPs)
clauses.rationale: SA-9 external service responsibilities.
clauses.gaps: PCI-specific TPSP compliance support requirements. SP 800-53 covers service provider responsibilities but PCI compliance support is industry-specific.

clauses.title: Suspected and confirmed security incidents that could impact the CDE are responded to immediately
clauses.rationale: IR family comprehensive for incident response.
clauses.gaps: Minor: PCI specifies CDE-specific incident response.
